intro: Cyclopogon millei, commonly known as the pink pohuehue, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking pink and white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a rosette-forming habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are borne on tall, erect stems and are known for their fragrant scent. Cyclopogon millei is a rare and endangered species, with limited populations found in specific regions of New Zealand.
